intro: Cacalia santacruzensis, commonly known as the Santa Cruz cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the coastline, where it thrives in full sun. It features slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
